Brad is a fantastic host! He's helpful and responsive. In our case, he was able to provide help above and beyond what most guests might expect.
The suite was perfect for us. It was clean and well stocked. It was not a huge space but it was large enough for me 6'6"+ and 260lbs. In fact, it had two things I always request: 1) a high shower head + hand-held shower head; and, 2) a king size bed.
If I had to give a "heads up" for anything, I would give a MILD caution about four things (just as high shower heads and king size beds are a dealbreaker for me, the following cautions may be important for someone else): 1) the kitchen is nice but on the small side. That was not a problem for us because we rarely needed more than one person in the kitchen at the same time; 2) the water pressure in the shower suddenly dropped once when I was taking a shower. The water pressure was never terribly strong but it was not weak enough to bother us; 3) the staircase entering the suite is steep with small steps (for someone with big feet like me) and has a 90 degree turn about two-thirds of the way up. This could be difficult depending on your physical status; and, 4) the entrance gate to the property is opened and closed manually and is tight if you only open one side. We were driving a Tesla Y and it just fit (the mirrors were close). A large vehicle would require both gates to be open. Also, it would be a real pain if you are driving by yourself (it was raining almost half the times we were coming or going.) Finally, the space between the gate and the road is narrow. Our car barely (and I mean barely) fit. The road is busy and though there is an extra lane that really should offer you a little spare room it rarely did because many drivers would race down the extra lane, using it as a normal lane even though it was clearly marked for cars turning right.
Again, I want to emphasize these were not major problems for us. We were easily able to manage these idiosyncrasies of the property. Every property is bound to have something about it that might be a dealbreaker for someone. This was not the case for us.
We loved our stay at Brad's place. We thought Brad was an amazing host. We would gladly stay there again and highly recommend it and him to others!

When my girlfriend and I arrived at the Majestic Old Hunter's Lodge in the afternoon of December 2nd, we were greeted by Meagan, her daughter, and their unbelievably cute dog Taco. When we turned down the driveway and saw the house for the first time, it was way more beautiful than we imagined. Our reactions were, "OH MY GOD!! THIS IS GOING TO BE AMAZING!". Meagan then proceeded to show us around the house and property and we could not have been happier or more excited for the weekend we were about to spend with the rest of our guests.
We had ten guests total, and brought air mattresses for those who did not have a bedroom. We set them up in the living room and found that there was ample space for everyone. The fire places provided plenty of warmth while also contributing to the "remote cabin", "winter feel" to the whole experience.
On Friday night, my girlfriend and I prepared dinner for everyone and also cooked breakfast Saturday morning. The Lowes grocery store was only about a mile away from the house, which was etremely convenient. The Lowes also had a section in the store where they sold craft beer, which we thought was really cool, we bought two growlers as souvenirs. The kitchen met all of our needs as far as being provided with pots, pans, cooking oils and spices, along with plenty of space for cooking and just hanging out in general. The twelve seat dining room table was a great space for everyone to sit and eat while also enjoying each others company.
After breakfast on Saturday we all started to get ready for the wedding we were all in town for, and with the three bathrooms and large walk-in closets, we had no issues at all. When getting home after the wedding we were able to take an Uber downtown, which was only fifteen minutes away. The Uber drivers sometimes had trouble finding us, but it was no big deal.
Check out was at noon on Sunday as opposed to a normal check out time of eleven, which was great to have that extra hour to pack everything up and get everyone ready for the drive home.
All in all, everyone had an amazing time and we could not have asked for a better location to spend the weekend for our best friend's wedding. When we come back to Winston-Salem for football games, or to visit friends and family, we will absolutely be looking to stay here at the Majestic Old Hunter's Lodge again.
Thank you SO much Meagan - Kristen and I look forward to seeing you again sometime soon!
